reasoning: HNF4A mutations account for approximately 2-3% of diazoxide-responsive hyperinsulinism cases. Overall congenital hyperinsulinism incidence is 1 in 50,000 births (~2 per 100k births). Estimating HNF4A-specific incidence at ~0.05 per 100k births based on this subtype frequency.
source: Orphanet; PMC scientific literature on congenital hyperinsulinism
